sect2.title: Creating the DHCP Network Interface Configuration Files
sect2.para: The following is an example for the eth0 interface. Create the /etc/sysconfig/network-devices/ifconfig.eth0 configuration file using the following commands. Adjust appropriately for additional interfaces:

screen.userinput:
cd /etc/sysconfig/network-devices && cat > ifconfig.eth0 << "EOF" SERVICE="dhcpcd"
# Start Command for DHCPCD DHCP_START="-q"
# Stop Command for DHCPCD DHCP_STOP="-k" EOF

sect2.para: The DHCP_START and DHCP_STOP variables arguments that are passed onto dhcpcd when starting and stoppping the service. More information about what can be passed can be found in the dhcpcd(8) man page.
